content: frogs in the grass baby blanket ©2024 by judy lamb difficulty level ★★☆☆☆ materials bernat softee baby 100% acrylic 50oz/140g 5 skeins 36-inch circular knitting needle size 6 u s /4 0 mm finished measurement approx 40 x 52 inches directions cast on 200 sts work seed st for 7 row see first 7 row of frog graph set up pattern as follows row 1 reading from right to left and starting with row 8 of frog graph right side work to end of graph knit next 34 sts work frog graph to the left of the bold line twice row 2 now reading from left to right work frog graph only to the bold line work first 5 sts of mock cable graph still reading left to right starting with row 2 then work mock cable graph between the bold lines 8 times then work the final 2 sts of mock cable graph twice work entire frog graph pattern is now set up continue working the frog and cable squares until the last 7 row of the frog graph remain skip those row and start over at the beginning of the frog graph working 7 row of seed stitch all the way across all motifs now work a mock cable square above the frog squares and a frog square above the mock cable squares note the first row only of the mock cable motif will be worked with plain knitting across 34 sts and then commence with row 2 of the graph continue alternating frog and cable squares until 7 row of squares are completed refer to picture complete blanket by working the final 7 row of seed stitch bind off frog graph special thanks to daisy and storm for the frog motif https //daisyandstorm com/2020/10/10/free-frog- dishcloth-or-afghan-square-knitting-pattern/ key to graphs knit on rs purl on ws purl on rs knit on ws mock cable graph yarn over sl 1 k2 psso ©2024 by judy lamb
